metadata.dc:author: Garabal, J
Pérez, B
López Campos, D
López Aguado, D
Campos, M E
metadata.dc:description: Diffuse idiopathic skeletal hyperostosis (DISH) with cervical involvement which cause dysphagia is a rare disease. The otolaryngologist usually can make its diagnostic with a barium swallowing esophagogram. Two patients with DISH are reported.
metadata.dc:title: Síndrome de Forestier. A propósito de dos casos.
[Forestier's syndrome. Report of two cases].
